Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

In a Euclidean domain with decidable equality, the greatest common divisor of any two elements divides the first element.

type: ∀ {R : Type u} [inst : EuclideanDomain R] [inst_1 : DecidableEq R] (a b : R), EuclideanDomain.gcd a b ∣ a
name: EuclideanDomain.gcd_dvd_left
docString: In a Euclidean domain with decidable equality, the greatest common divisor of any two elements divides the first element.

This theorem states that for any type `α` that is a cancel commutative monoid with zero and also a Greatest Common Divisor (gcd) monoid, and for any elements `a`, `b`, `c`, and `d` of `α`, if `a` divides `b` and `c` divides `d`, then the gcd of `a` and `c` divides the gcd of `b` and `d`. Here, "divides" means that there exists another element of `α` such that multiplying that element by the divisor yields the dividend.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [inst_1 : GCDMonoid α] {a b c d : α},
  a ∣ b → c ∣ d → gcd a c ∣ gcd b d
name: gcd_dvd_gcd
docString: This theorem states that for any type `α` that is a cancel commutative monoid with zero and also a Greatest Common Divisor (gcd) monoid, and for any elements `a`, `b`, `c`, and `d` of `α`, if `a` divides `b` and `c` divides `d`, then the gcd of `a` and `c` divides the gcd of `b` and `d`. Here, "divides" means that there exists another element of `α` such that multiplying that element by the divisor yields the dividend.

Any quotient group of a divisible group is divisible

type: {A : Type u_2} → [inst : AddCommGroup A] → (B : AddSubgroup A) → [inst_1 : DivisibleBy A ℕ] → DivisibleBy (A ⧸ B) ℕ
name: QuotientAddGroup.divisibleBy
docString: Any quotient group of a divisible group is divisible

For any non-zero natural number `n`, `n` is a divisor of itself.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), n ≠ 0 → n ∈ n.divisors
name: Nat.mem_divisors_self
docString: For any non-zero natural number `n`, `n` is a divisor of itself.

The theorem `Int.gcd_dvd_left` states that for any two integers `a` and `b`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `a` and `b` divides `a`. This is written in the Lean theorem prover as `↑(Int.gcd a b) ∣ a`, where `Int.gcd a b` computes the gcd of `a` and `b`, the `↑` operator converts that gcd from a natural number to an integer, and `∣` represents the "divides" relation. In mathematical terms, if $gcd(a, b) = d$, then $d | a$.

type: ∀ {a b : ℤ}, ↑(a.gcd b) ∣ a
name: Int.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The theorem `Int.gcd_dvd_left` states that for any two integers `a` and `b`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `a` and `b` divides `a`. This is written in the Lean theorem prover as `↑(Int.gcd a b) ∣ a`, where `Int.gcd a b` computes the gcd of `a` and `b`, the `↑` operator converts that gcd from a natural number to an integer, and `∣` represents the "divides" relation. In mathematical terms, if $gcd(a, b) = d$, then $d | a$.

Greatest common divisor of a multiset

type: {α : Type u_1} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Multiset α → α
name: Multiset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a multiset

The greatest common divisor between two elements.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [self : GCDMonoid α] → α → α → α
name: GCDMonoid.gcd
docString: The greatest common divisor between two elements.

Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  0 < IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_zero_le
docString: Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

No zero divisors.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [self : CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring α] {a b : α}, a * b = 0 → a = 0 ∨ b = 0
name: CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring.eq_zero_or_eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero
docString: No zero divisors.

The proposition that a sequence indexed by integers is a divisibility sequence.

type: {R : Type u} → [inst : CommRing R] → (ℤ → R) → Prop
name: IsDivSequence
docString: The proposition that a sequence indexed by integers is a divisibility sequence.

The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), Nat.divisors (m * n) = Nat.divisors m * Nat.divisors n
name: Nat.divisors_mul
docString:
The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] (a b : α), gcd a b ∣ a
name: GCDMonoid.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

Division of rational functions.

type: {K : Type u_1} → [inst : CommRing K] → [inst_1 : IsDomain K] → RatFunc K → RatFunc K → RatFunc K
name: RatFunc.div
docString: Division of rational functions.

If an integer with larger absolute value divides an integer, it is
zero.

type: ∀ {a b : ℤ}, a ∣ b → Int.natAbs b < Int.natAbs a → b = 0
name: Int.eq_zero_of_dvd_of_natAbs_lt_natAbs
docString:
If an integer with larger absolute value divides an integer, it is
zero.

Least common multiple of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.lcm
docString: Least common multiple of a finite set

Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x ≠ 0
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_ne_zero'
docString: Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

For `a ≤ b`, `a` left divides `b`

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Mul α] [inst_1 : LE α] [self : ExistsMulOfLE α] {a b : α}, a ≤ b → ∃ c, b = a * c
name: ExistsMulOfLE.exists_mul_of_le
docString: For `a ≤ b`, `a` left divides `b`

Only finitely many maximal ideals of `R` divide a given nonzero ideal.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R] {I : Ideal R},
  I ≠ 0 → Set.Finite {v | v.asIdeal ∣ I}
name: Ideal.finite_factors
docString: Only finitely many maximal ideals of `R` divide a given nonzero ideal.

Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

type: Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}
name: Nat.factorization_inj
docString: Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

The separable degree of an irreducible polynomial divides its degree.

type: ∀ {F : Type u} [inst : Field F] {f : Polynomial F}, Irreducible f → Polynomial.natSepDegree f ∣ Polynomial.natDegree f
name: Irreducible.natSepDegree_dvd_natDegree
docString: The separable degree of an irreducible polynomial divides its degree.

The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

name: PNat.gcd
docString:
The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] {a b c : α}, a ∣ c → a ∣ b → a ∣ gcd c b
name: GCDMonoid.dvd_gcd
docString: Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.
